metadata.title: CVE-2014-8275 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
OpenSSL before 0.9.8zd, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0p, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1k doesnot enforce certain constraints on certificate data, which allows remoteattackers to defeat a fingerprint-based certificate-blacklist protectionmechanism by including crafted data within a certificate's unsignedportion, related to crypto/asn1/a_verify.c, crypto/dsa/dsa_asn1.c,crypto/ecdsa/ecs_vrf.c, and crypto/x509/x_all.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8275` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu10
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu10').
